meanings.definition: To rebound off a surface in a series of bounces.
meanings.sent1: The ball was ricocheting off the walls in the small room.
meanings.sent2: The stone ricocheted off the pavement and hit the window.
meanings.sent3: The rubber duck was ricocheting around the bathtub, causing a splashy mess.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter ricocheted through the room, infecting everyone with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the drum ricocheting in the empty hall was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The action of bouncing off a surface in a series of bounces.
meanings.sent1: The loud ricocheting of the ball echoed in the gymnasium.
meanings.sent2: The police officer heard the ricocheting of bullets in the alley.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected ricocheting of the ping pong ball made the game more exciting.
meanings.sent4: The ricocheting of ideas in the brainstorming session led to a creative breakthrough.
meanings.sent5: The rapid ricocheting of the pinball machine kept the players on edge.
